alert.note: Alert for Marshall (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 9:05PM CST by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHERN MARSHALL...SOUTHWESTERN JACKSON AND SOUTHEASTERN MADISON COUNTIES THROUGH 945 PM CST... At 905 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Owens Cross Roads, or 10 miles southeast of Redstone Arsenal, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40-50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Southern Huntsville, Owens Cross Roads, Grant, Gurley, Woodville, Pleasant Groves, Langston, Paint Rock, Lim Rock, and Trenton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CST for north central Alabama. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 200 AM CST for northeastern Alabama.
